question.title: error on file upload ADFS0120E: Can not resolve the MBean reference ObjectName for WebSphere:name=FileTransferClient
question.body:
I am trying to deploy an ear file on a remote Websphere AS server - 9.0. Not sure if there is an upload option. Tried different classes and this is executed without errors, but when I open the server log I see a warning. I need to use only Java not wsadmin.

String earFilePath = "D:/temp/DefaultApplication2.ear";
String remoteFilePath = "/opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer/installableApps/DefaultApplication2.ear";
Set<ObjectName> mbeans = adminClient.queryNames(
            new ObjectName("WebSphere:name=FileTransferServer,*"),
            null
);
if (mbeans.isEmpty()) {
    throw new RuntimeException("No FileTransferServer MBean found!");
}
ObjectName fileTransferMBean = mbeans.iterator().next(); 
String nodeName = "DefaultNode01";
adminClient.invoke(
            fileTransferMBean,
            "send",
            new Object[] { nodeName, localFilePath, remoteFileName },
            new String[] { "java.lang.String", "java.lang.String", "java.lang.String" }
);
System.out.println("Upload complete: " + remoteFileName);

in the system log:

[5/16/25 12:35:22:706 UTC] 00000233 FileTransferS A   ADFS0120E: Can not resolve the MBean reference ObjectName for WebSphere:name=FileTransferClient,type=FileTransferClient,node=DefaultNode01,process=nodeagent,*.

question_comments.body: yes, i have tested it , installApplication is working fine if the ear file is available on the server side . if you try with a remote client , you get error that the file does not exist. In the end i am using ("WebSphere:type=AntAgent,*") and is working fine, not sure if this is the correct way .. or there is some other parameter that have to be used for transfer/upload
Did you look at the app management proxy ? It's a bit "higher-level" than having to call individual MBeans but uses Java like an MBean client app: ibm.com/docs/en/was-nd/…
